name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: A great collection of provincial parks arrayed along the North shore of Lake Superior.  We can there at least once each year, and have never been disappointed.  Great place for families or couples

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Gorgeous views with so much to see. Perfect for people looking to get away. Plenty of activities.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Breath taking. Would go back in a heartbeat. The drive is long, but so worth it. If you haven't been to the this part of Ontario, you are missing out. Don't count on the water being warm. We went the second week of August and being the true Canadians that we are, it was quite (shall we say) refreshing.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Surprisingly beautiful park just hours north of Sault Ste. Marie. The park has a headquarters with bathroom facilities but is mostly primitive. There is some hiking, canoeing, and several from-the-car strolls. No food except up in Wawa.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: We had a great spot with the lake right in front of us! There was lots to do and see! Showers and bathrooms and laundry facilities. Power hook up was a bit far but we had plenty of cord. The sound of the waves was incredible! A thunder ...

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: I love this place. Definitely want to buy property in this area someday.  I wish my family had not immigrated to Wisconsin! I love Canada!

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Nice campground. Bit isolated though. An hour to Wawa for shops. Transcanada  can be noisy as it is very close to the park. Lot of tractor trailers going all night.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Amazing views of fall colors in the end of September, start of October.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Drove past the park in fall. Amazing scenery and twists. The lake and mountain combination on road is mesmerizing.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review:
Lake Superior Provincial Park,  Agawa campground is amazing. 
The coastal drive to get there is breathtaking. I tented, but you can easily rent a cabin or lodge along the way. 
The flora and fauna is very different from Southern Ontario. ...

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review:
I visited the park a few years ago. This park is awesome! Everything is bigger in this region. We had a great time from camping at Gargantua Bay to hiking the Sand River and even bushwhacking to a campsite that was not used in years. 

If it was not so far from Toronto I would visit more often.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: It's on Lake Superior. It's beautiful. The park offers many trails. Both campgrounds are amazing. All the staff we've dealt with are excellent. I mean it's on Lake Superior...what more do you need !!!!

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: This part of Ontario is gorgeous. The lake is shimmering from the Ontario side. The hike down to the petroglyphs is rugged in places. The cables along the rocks are in need of repair. The government needs to put some money into improving ...

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: This place is beautiful and even if it's hard to get here you should probably go. I cycled through the park which is both properly hilly and amazing. Must stop at Old Woman Bay, Katherine Cove and Agawa Bay.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Went camping and it was cold in July! Really nice play overall definitely should visit.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: What can you say about this place it's the amazing views amazing places amazing experience the whole way through this place and it's huge

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: We had the nicest camp spot! Campground was nice and quiet so we stayed 2 nights.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Beautiful park with great campsites at Rabbit Blanket Lake camping area. Many sites are split level and quite large. Lots to do for fishing, swimming, hiking etc

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Love this park. Book campgrounds in advance as they do fill up quickly. Amazing shoreline and interior hiking.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: We took the fall tour and the colors were unbelievable. Highly recommended the trip.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Largest fresh water lake!! Very exciting place! Back country camping is very lovely, with well maintained sites and very helpful staff. If you are visiting, must see places are Old Woman Bay, Pictographs, Bathtub Island and Agawa River Falls.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Staff great, park itself is large and very nice. Lot of good hiking trails. Comfort stations are in good shape. Mediocre rating due to overgrown state of agawa bay campground electric sites. Very hard to fit trailers into many sites they ...

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Beautiful scenery, plenty of trails, lookouts and campsites. Trails we visited were physically demanding. Don't recommend for parents with children under 10.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Park is awesome in terms of dense forest and various places to visit as well as different trails and waterfalls. Park facility needs to improve including washroom cleanliness.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Nice trails with great views of superior lake itself , great view in the larger campground with clean and new showers butvery old comfort station in the smaller campground

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review:
Awesome hiking along the north shore. Rent a canoe and go to Miji lakefor a couple of days.
Great camp sites interior, beaches all to yourself.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Stayed there 2 nights. I remember camping there back in the 60's with family and climbing the rocks and swimming in the Cold Lake. Great place to be on the beach at sunset.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: It took me about 14 hours to even reach here but it was worth every single second. What a well preserved place. With clean facilities and friendly staff, it is an absolute must-see bucket list worthy experience. The lake itself... Stunning. This park was very splendid and the scenery was bewitching.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Beautiful park! Old woman bay is beautiful. Nokomis trail is very steep with challenging rocks but worth it. The Agawa Pictographs area must! But be careful because it can be very slippery.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Awesome Fall Foliage!  The Agawa Rock Petroglyph is part of the Lake Superior Provincial Park

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: The park is great, beautiful and the park office manger Bob Elliott is very informative. Love the park.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: This is a really beautiful trip but there is no place to stop and take photos or even slow down.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: It is very well maintained park and also one of the largest clear water lake. Staff is very helpful.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Nice views from hiking trail lookouts, Agawa Bay campground gives a pebble/sand beach experience.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Nature at its finest. Backcountry galore to visit, friendly staff at the office. This isn't Disney Land folks it is the real deal, bring hiking boots, a kayak and a sense of adventure, and don't forget the bear bag, they don't need your food.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Beautiful part of the country,  breathtaking views and the sunset over lake superior is incredible. Very little privacy and electrical connections can be very far, still a beautiful place.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review:

Make sure you take the time to make it to ...

review: Awesomeness!!  Everywhere,  great camping,  hiking,  back country or lakeshore.

review: Stunning views. This drive should be on everyone's bucket list.

name: Lake Superior Provincial Park
review: Agawa Bay is my favourite beach in Ontario, even though it is rock covered. The many hiking trails and pristine waters are worth revisiting year after year. The campground is clean, and well maintained. This park is worth the long drive from the GTA.
